review_title: Great Opporutnity to Build Relationships, Low Pay
job_title: Faculty Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Great way to continue connecting with key faculty and help fellow students excell in the classroom
cons: Minimum-wage for somewhat specialized work is fortunuate, regulations prevent students from working more than 20 hours per week as well.

pros: Great Pay, flexible schedule and able to work from home full time
cons: Leadership is not innovative, refused to create and use streamlined processes. Systems and LMS extremely outdated

review_title: Reasonable and understanding toward student workers
job_title: Teaching Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Easy to manage a job here and school. Generally laid back, easy to work for. Pay is decent for a part time college job
cons: Sometimes there's some disorganization and poor communication regarding the financial end of things, but it is not a big deal

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New City, NY
pros: Warm workplace environment. Co-workers and supervisors tend to be caring and genuinely invested in their employees. Very flexible with hours and working from home if necessary.
cons: A tight budget makes raises hard to acheive (both hourly and salaried). Department directors spend most of their time in meetings.

job_title: Faculty Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Excellent opportunities to work with talented faculty!
cons: Minimum wage, so could be better paid for a sometimes-difficult position

job_title: Student Worker in New York, NY
pros: The college has clear values and expectations. I've had a great experience!
